line.en: A day near the end of August.
At the start of summer vacation, nearly half of\nFlying Fish Manor's residents leave. It's been a\nwhile since the building has been this crowded.
'The vegetables are all cut!'
'All finished here, too.'
'The water's boiling. What should I do next?'
'Could you throw those in the oven to bake? How\nlong should I put them in for?'
Everyone was asking for my instructions all at\nonce. I felt like a master chef.

'Put the cut vegetables into the boiling water.
Cover the pot and let it boil for around 10
minutes. Wait a minute on baking that. Bake it
together with these.'
While rattling off instructions on the fly, I\nalso had a job of my own to do.
It had been a long time since I've prepared\ndinner for such a large number of people.
'What can I do to help?'
'Hey, Amane! Could you come over here and check\nout the TV?'
'Amane plus knife equals dangerous... You take\ncare of her, Aoi!'
'Mornin' Amane, shall we go over there and watch\nsome TV?'
'But I wanted to help...'
Even though she really did want to help, Kanako\ndragged Amane in front of the TV.
People and food. The heat and fire from the oven\nand stove. Mixed together, it seemed like a\nwarzone.
Why does it suddenly feel like this...?
'We're finally living together, Yoru! It's so\nexciting!'
'I guess. I don't see how things are really going\nto change, though. You always sleep in my room\nanyway, right?'
Today is the first day back at the Soaring Club's\ndormitory.
However, nothing really changed that much, to be\nhonest.
Ageha still stays at her family home, and Amane\nstill comes here for free food.
This is what dorm life is about.
And just like last year, there is an early\nmorning watch duty.
By the end of summer, a Morning Glory will make\nan appearance.
It wouldn't be strange for it to appear any time\nnow.
To be on watch duty meant that you had to stay\nover night at the secret base and watch for even\nthe slightest change in weather.

I prepared dinner earlier than usual to try to
take advantage of having everyone gathered.
Immediately after tonight's dinner, we will have
a meeting.
'Alright! Finished!'
'Oh wow, there's so much delicious looking food.'
'Come over here and help me bring it to the\ntable.'
'Sure!'
The food that everyone prepared was carried to\nthe table.
The sight of so much hearty food seemed to put\neveryone in good spirits.
'It's been awhile since I've had Aoi's cooking.'
'I'm starving. Can we start eating?'
'Before we start, the leader has a few things\nshe'd like to say.'
Kotori cleared her throat with authority.
'Ah, hello everyone. I would like to thank you\nall for your hard work throughout the year.'
'With each day, the goal that we dream of draws\ncloser. Flying alongside a Morning Glory.'
'We have only one chance. Failure will not be\ntolerated. Until summer is finished, let's stay\nfired up and make no mistakes.'
'That was a long one Kotori!'
'I gotta eat!'
'Umm, I'm not a member of the Soaring Club, so is\nit OK if I started eating?'
'Quack, quack!'
'Cheh, you guys...'
'Come on, seriously, the foods gonna get cold.'
'Waaaaaaa! There's so much delicious looking\nfood, eat until your heart's content, and call\nout your fighting spirit!'
'Yeah!'
'Yeah!'
'Let's eat!'
At once, every one scrambled to take food.
'Seriously... That just killed the mood.'
'Hahaha. Well, when you go out with guns blazing,\nit's hard to keep the momentum up till the end.'
'No, it's not like that at all. It's like I'm\nlike the last soldier standing.'
I'm not sure exactly what I'm off to fight, but\nI'm going in with a great fighting spirit.
Since I flew the glider the other day, my\nmotivation has been boundless, but wasted.

Over the past few days I have been practicing
flying from dawn till dusk. I've kept my
exhaustion hidden; however my improvement in
flying is physically visible.
'Very soon were are going to be able to see that\nbeautiful looking cloud.'
'That reminds me, Asa, it was you who saw the\ncloud from Windmill Hill right?'
'Yes, it was absolutely beautiful. The cloud and\nthe sky the glider flew in, too.'
'What could be cooler than that?'
'Oh... 'munch-munch'... that was close to Morning\nGlory... 'munch-munch'... But... I still wouldn't\ncall it so.'
Amane makes a spectacular mess by eating as she\nspeaks.
'Hey AMANE! Are you gonna eat, or you gonna\ntalk?'
'Well... ahem... That was a sign that a true\nMorning Glory would come this year.'
Today we heard that last year's cloud sighting\ncould very well be a sign that this year a real\nMorning Glory was indeed coming.
The story goes back a few hours ago.
'This data is the basis of my reasoning.'
The computer screen showed the variety of data\ntypes Amane referred too.
'And this all means...?'
'It means that at the end of summer, there is an\nextremely high possibility that a Morning Glory\nwill form.'
Amane's words brought a quiet tension and\nexcitement to the room.
I listened to Amane's speech and believed it was\nsound logic.
'Um, is it alright if I ask a question?'
'Shoot.'
'When you say there is a high possibility, how\nhigh are you talking about?'
'Right... So... High possibility... We can't say\nin exact numbers, but a rough calculation would\nbe around 30 percent.'
'Wha-? How is that possibly a high possibility?'
'Given that the completely not happening is the\nregular stat, wouldn't you agree that 30 percent\nis pretty high?'
It was just as Yoru said.
The phenomenon known as a Morning Glory occurs\nbut once in a few decades.
'If that's the case, that is rather amazing,\nisn't it? Even last year's small sighting was an\nexceptional appearance.'
'The cloud Aoi and I flew by last year wasn't\neven close to being considered a Morning Glory.'
'Ok, so what was it?'
'Just a regular cloud.'
'But still, this is the basis for my reasoning.\nHere, look at these.'
Amane took the mouse and brought up more data on\nthe screen.

We just received this project data from the newly
constructed windmills. The data showed detailed
weather data around the area collected over the
past few months.
Amane analyzed the numbers and just recently came\nto new conclusions.
The current display showed two types of data.
'Here is the data from last years cloud sighting.\nAnd this here, is from 26th of August, 28 years\nago.'
'From August 26th, 28 years ago?'
A completely unknown date.
The data taken from two completely different\ndates truly resemble each other.
'They really do look alike don't they? But, what\ndoes it mean?'
'We don't have complete records, but last years\nwannabe Morning Glory's data resembles this,\nhere.'
'Meaning?'
'In summary, during the next year, following the\nwannabe cloud formation, a true Morning Glory was\nformed.'
So it's possible to say that a true formation\ncould happen this year too, right?
She nodded.
Our eyes devoured the information on the screen.

At first glance, no matter how much we stared at
them, the lists of numbers were meaningless, and
we could make no sense of them, but Amane's
speech won us over.
'So you're saying that if a Morning Glory does\nnot appear by the end of the summer, then it's\nnot going to come at all?'
'There's practically no doubt about it. As I\nexplained earlier, the conditions involved to\nform such a cloud...'
'I understand that part, but...'
Kotori held back her confusion as Amane began\nonce again to explain things from the beginning.
Sometimes such complex explanations just weren't\nnecessary. Sometimes, you just need to know the\nprinciples and the result.
'Which is all the more reason...'
'Ah, the payback for that day.'
I could not deny a fearless smile forming on my\nmouth.
Amane's explanation was the spark that set fire\nto my motivation. I was ready for action.
'The problem lies with the flight plan. We must\nrevise Amane's data.'
As everyone questioned Amane, I sat and\nconsidered the factors.
'Last year, the cloud that Aoi and I flew about\nappeared approximately 1km high.'
'But according to the Old Boy's navigation\njournal, the Morning Glory that appeared 27 years\nago was at 2 km.'
'We can't fly up to one kilometer, can we?'
Ageha rubbed her chin as she thought.
Two kilometers is somewhat low for a cloud.
Since we are using a winch system to fly, we have\nyet to experience flying at that altitude.
'We could do it if we had a plane...'
'Are we able to fly to those heights? Are there\nthermals?'
'There should be, but...'
I thought about it for a minute.
'The problem is, should a Morning Glory form, it\nwould do so around dawn.'
'What does that mean?'
'It means that thermals are few and far between.'
'It takes time for the night time air to warm up\nagain.'
'If we leisurely waited until sunrise, it would\nalready be too late.'
You need sunlight to warm up surface ground.
Without the heat from the ground's surface,\nthermals can't be formed.
I listened to Amane's explanation with a nod, and\nadded a few words.
'If possible, you'll want to start flying before\nsunrise, while it's still dim.'
'But it would be hard to find thermals. On the\nother hand, there are thermals above the lake,\naren't there?'
The way heat is transferred is different between\nland and water.
Land easily heats and cools, but with water it's\nmore difficult.
During the day, the ground temperature is cooler\nthan over lakes and seas, creating a gentle\ndowndraft.
But at night, the opposite occurs. The ground\ncools first, and the air above the not-quite-cool\nlake sends air currents upwards.
'Well, that would probably be difficult. It's\ndifferent in the middle of the night, but at\nsunrise is also expected to be chilled.'
'That says it all...'
'Of course, we only have one chance.'
We learned a lot from our mistakes last year.\nThis time, we have to create a good flight plan.
We've already talked about it countless times,\nbut, with the new data, now we can come up with\nsomething a little more solid.
With a sidelong glance, Asa sighed as she opened\nher mouth.
'Meaning the likelihood of us not taking off is\nhigh, right?'
'Now's not the time to dodge questions. Is it\nalright?'
'That was true last time, too. That will be just\nas much of a challenge next year and the year\nafter, too.'
'But if the cloud comes this year, it's\nabsolutely impossible to run away from it.'
Kotori and Ageha nodded in agreement with my\nstrong words.
The two of us cannot forget last year's\nfrustration.
'And so once again, the traditions of the Soaring\nClub are being handed down from one generation of\nstudents to the next.'
'That sounds like Amane!'
'I wouldn't go that far...'
'Well, isn't that nice. It's more than most\npeople can get out of their student life.'
Kotori made a firm fist.
'Like Amane said, we've got one shot! Let's do\nit!'
Ageha and I nodded in agreement with serious\nexpressions.
'By the way, who's going to fly?'
'That glider can only hold two people.'
It was just an innocent question, but none of us\ncould make the words come out of our mouths.
We looked at each other, and then at practically\nthe same time, we all gazed at Amane.
'Me...? I'm not flying. I can't even imagine how\nscary flying two kilometers into the air would\nbe.'
'Is that really OK with you, Amane? When the time\ncomes, you might be able to do it.'
Amane easily shook her head.
'Didn't I already tell you? I'll help you with\nall of it, but it's up to you guys in the end,\nunderstand?'
When she says it so frankly like that, it sound\nkinda sad.
For the senior students, the glider is a thing of\nthe past.
'Wait a minute, wait a minute, shouldn't we think\nthis through? More importantly, right now, how\nare we going to get the glider up?'
'That's right. For the time being, we don't even\nhave a flight plan...'
Everyone ate while discussing ideas. The argument\nbecame increasingly more heated.
'The bath is open!'
I walked into the dining hall as I towel-dried my\nhair.
The usual crowd already came and went. Usually\nthe last to take a bath, today I went in first.
Everyone was hanging out at our normal table.
'Wha?!'
'Sis, you're just asking for dad's attention.'
'Come on, I am not. Absolutely not.'
'Asa is up front and easy to understand.'
'Did Amane already head home?'
'She said she was full, and said to tell you\nthanks for the food.'
'Amane is such a glutton for food. Thanks to\neveryone, we could all drag her out of her cave.'
If that wasn't the case, I would just be a\nbabysitter composing poorly written emails.
Hooray for gluttony.
'...And Kotori?'
'I'm guessing she's probably in her room\npracticing.'
'The simulator?'
The other day, Kotori borrowed Hibari's laptop.\nShe has been using it to practice on the\nsimulator in her room.
Unfortunately, people don't see Kotori's hard\nwork as a virtue. Instead, they see her as being\nantisocial and arrogant.
Everyone calls it 'secret practicing.
'Should I go get her?'
'No, it's cool. We shouldn't bother her.'
'But, if it's you, Aoi, then...'
'I'm not saying that we shouldn't meet with her\nat all, just for the time being... Well, it would\nbe nice to see her some...'
'Right, I'm going to go get ready.'
'Whew, I'm thirsty.'
'Quack!'
'Well, look who decided to join us!'
'You guys are still here? Did Amane already go\nhome?'
'Yeah, she left. I guess it's about time for me\nto head out too.'
'Oh. Take care.'
'...(Huh huh)'
'If you're looking for Aoi, he already left.'
'What? No way, at this hour!?'

'Uh-huh. Somebody's neglecting her boyfriend in
favor of a simulator. What else would you expect
from a woman who's actually in love with the
sky.'
'Oh... I wanted to wish him well...'
'There really is a great view of the sky from\nhere.'
While climbing up the slanted surface of Windmill\nHill, I gazed at the starry sky that spread\nalongside it.
It was clear today, giving a great view of the\nstars.
On top of that, from Windmill Hill there are few\nobstructions to block the view.
Last year, the same sheet covered glider was\nplaced on the runway.
The view from the secret base is better than from\nthe garden of Flying Fish Manor.
I don't know what's responsible for the change in\natmosphere.
You have to catch it within even a second's time.
I'm doing the watch alone, however it isn't safe\nto have a lone girl sitting here in this remote\nlocation, so the shift is done in pairs.
'I drop them off and pick them up here, but I\nstill worry even with two people here during the\nnight.'
Nothing but solar panels and windmills in the\nsprawling space.
As if mankind was gone, and only machines\nremained.
Inside my pocket, my cell phone chimed.
'Got a message...'
It was from Kotori.
I'm sorry I got all self-absorbed in my room. I\njust want to say good night and take care...
It was the kind of message that makes the heart\ngo fuzzy.
I didn't realize it, but it seemed that I was\nlonely.
Tomorrow morning, I'll get up early and wait for\nyou. Good night.
'Hahaha...'
Finally, a small smile escaped my lips.
'Who would have thought... This is nice.'
There were no words to truly describe it. Reading\nthe mail gave me a strange, relieved feeling.
'I got a message from Aoi.'
'Quack!'
Thanks for your message. You were working hard on\npracticing, right?
'Why is it that practicing is considered impolite\nbehavior?'
There's also flight practice tomorrow, so there's\nno reason to overdo it. Get some rest.
When I get back, could you help get breakfast\nready? I love you. Good night.
'He said... 'I love you'.'
'Ahhh... aaaah...'
'Quaaaaack!'
'Good night, Aoi.'
'Al-right! Time to get ready for bed, for a\nbright tomorrow!'
'Quaaack!'
'...But before that.'
'I should send him a message him and tell him I\nlove him too...'
'Ou- Ouch! Ah! Ageha!'
'Huh? Geez, you're such a baby! And so is Kumoi.'
'Hey Ageha. As promised, I'm here for the\ninspection.'
'Hello, and sorry for making you wait. Take as\nlong as you need to look through it.'
'By the way, where is this glider?'
'Right now, it's in the middle of a practice run.\nProbably high in the sky. Ummm... Ah! Ouch!'
'Where?'
'Here, use these binoculars.'
'Thanks. I wonder where it is...'
'Oh, look! Down under that long, thin cloud. The\nsun is reflecting on the wing. Can you see it?\nAh! There, the light just reflected.'
'That's it?'
'It's the first time I've seen the glider in\nflight. It's pretty amazing, being that high up.'
'It depends on the day, but in theory, it can\nsometimes go above the clouds.'
'Wow, really? It flies really well! And there\nreally isn't an engine, right?'
'Who's the pilot?'
'Kotori.'
'And Aoi?'
'Even though she's flying, she doesn't need to\nuse her legs. Aoi is up there with her, teaching\nher how to fly.'
'I see... Ah.'
'Huh?'
'...Wa... Wa... Wait! That's dangerous right?\nSpinning in circles while falling like that!?'
'Nuugh... g-g-g... gggghwa!!?'
The glider fell towards the ground spinning in a\ncorkscrew.
The field of visions spins, and the sense of\nbalance is lost.
As you turn the screw to the outer side, you\nexperience g-force.
'Don't lose your grip on things, deal with the\ng-force! If you do it like I taught, you can do\nit!'
'First, put the aileron in neutral!'
'O-Ok!'
Kotori put the yoke in neutral.
'Next, rotate the yoke in the opposite direction\nof the glider's spin!'
'Rotate in opposite direction of the glider...!'
Even before I gave the instruction, Kotori had\nstarted steering in the opposite direction of the\nrotation.
Immediately, the yoke leaned towards the\ndirection it was in before.
'Try not to let the nose fall too much! The main\nwings need to take the lifting power back!'
'O-O-Ok!'
Finally, when the nose of the glider fell just\nright and the wings were able to stream airflow,\nregular flight was restored.
When the rudder was placed back in neutral, it\nwas as if nothing had happened. We flew like\nnormal.
'Great recovery!'
'Ah-ha-ha-ha...'
When we stabilized, Kotori took a look at the\noutside landscape and sighed deeply in relief.
We didn't just almost avoid an accident.
I had intentionally let the glider spin.
We had just been practicing spin recovery\ntactics.
'We barely lost any altitude. Great flying\nKotori!'
'Wow, that really is more flustering than a\nnormal stall.'
To stall means that the main wings lose\nconnection with the air currents, causing the\nglider to lose lift.
Without lift, the glider will fall.
However, if you know the right procedures, you\ncan recover from a stall.
So for the sake of study, you need to create a\nstall situation in practice.
The most important thing for a glider pilot is\npractice.
Even in practice, spin and stall procedures are\nquite vicious.
A spin is when the body of a plane turns like a\nscrew while falling.
In a worse case scenario, a weak point in the\nframe of the body could be lost, forcing the\npilot to parachute.
'Compared to the response time, you dealt with\nthe procedures very precisely. Were you scared?'
'No, not really. I kept the image of recovery\nlocked in my mind.'
'I see.'
During a stall, the pilot becomes confused.

While spinning, the pilot experiences the
sensation of falling, and it's a pretty scary
feeling. It's natural to become flustered with
your only thought being, 'I gotta get control!
However, in that confusion, should the pilot\nperform the wrong maneuver, they could worsen the\nsituation.
Kotori didn't loose confidence, and her calm\ncontrol in the scenario allowed her to recover\nquickly.
'(She had such a level head for her first\nrecovery).'
I remember losing my calm pretty quickly the\nfirst time I practiced this maneuver.
'For some reason or another, I was just able to\nfeel it out.'
'Don't get cocky. If you forget the danger during\nstalls and spins, your reaction time might be\nslow.'
When talking about stalls, there are two types of\npractice.
The first regards how to recover.
The second is about teaching the body how to tell\nwhen the glider is about to stall or spin.
There are several signs.
More important than reading the meters is\nunderstating the feel of flying. In this case the\nbody is introduced to the feel of g-force.
Once experienced, the body will remember the\nsensation enough to prompt the pilot into taking\nmeasures to prevent a stall.
Of course, the experience of performing an actual\nrecovery is also important.
'Thanks to practices like these, I think Amane\nand I escaped some harm.'
'At that time, just seeing it would give you\nchills, there was this extreme downdraft...'
A year ago, we experienced a strong downdraft. We\nsuddenly lost flight power and fell.
We were so absorbed in the moment that it seemed\nthe glider fixed itself upright. I think it was\ndue to not mastering these skills in practice.
'Alright, let's find a thermal again and head\nback up to the sky.'
'Alright!'
To continue practicing recoveries, we had to\nreach a good enough height to fall safely.
'I see, so they are doing it intentionally. They\nare in recovery training.'
'They're doing some pretty dangerous maneuvers.'
'Don't worry about it. If need be, Aoi can take\nover.'
'Of course, when flying in the sky there is\nnothing more dangerous.'
'Huh? Those guys aren't coming down.'
'They are going up one more time to do it again,\nright? I guess we don't have much time left.'
'I wonder what exactly that means...'
'According to Amane's predictions, there's a good\nchance that a Morning Glory will appear within\nthe next ten days.'
'A Morning Glory?'
'A long cylindrical cloud that rarely forms, and\nspans across the lake. It's our goal to fly with\nthat cloud.'
'Amane has a picture board covered with images of\nthat strange cloud.'
'If Kotori is so into flying, then she should be\nthe main pilot. I'll talk with Aoi.'
'Who the pilot is should be kept a secret.'
'Firstly, it should be someone who worked very\nhard, and Kotori certainly did a lot.'
'That's true, but there's no reason to change out\nKotori. She's been enrolled in the Keifuu Academy\nfor quite a while now.'
'Have you know her since the beginning?'
'Huh? Of course. We were all concerned when we\nheard about a student with disabled legs.'
'As expected of the person born to become the\nhead of the student council.'
'Well, I don't know any other students with an\nattitude that bad from within the same class.'
'Sigh. When we were sophomores, it was like why\neven bother?'
'What? Huh? Who's coming here?'
'Arrrrgh.'
Kotori gradually took the glider higher inside a\nthermal.
'Any time is good, now.'
'I think we can fly a little bit higher. Is it\nok?'
The purpose of today's training was to cover\nstall recovery, and there was no reason to fly\nhigher than this.
But the way Kotori asked, I couldn't say no.
'Sure. Let's see how much higher we can go.'
Being able to catch a thermal to fly higher is\nimportant practice after all.
'Thanks.'
Kotori flew the glider around the updrafts that\nthe eyes couldn't see. Little by little, she\nbrought the glider higher and higher.
This is a place you always wanted to see, right?
'...Cumulonimbus clouds break through to the\nstratosphere right?'
'They really are big, aren't they.'
'So to be here means that we were also in the\nstratosphere.'

'We might be able to fly up here, but this is
where we should stop. Inside cumulonimbus clouds,
the air flows in downbursts. Never mind things
like thunder. We should keep to safely first.'
Even jumbo-jets will avoid cumulonimbus clouds if\nthey can.
Besides, at these heights, the sky is like an\nunknown world for us.
I would rather stay safe and be able to go home\nthan take the chance of going in briefly and\nhaving something happen.
'The sky is so high...'
'Beyond the sky is space.'
Kotori absently muttered 'space' as she gazed out\nbeyond the canopy.
From her profile, she looked like a mysterious\nchild.
When Amane flew, she kept her curiosity hidden,\nbut Kotori had the shining eyes of a young child.
People usually wish to have such naive feelings.
'About what you said before...'
'About me, when I was gazing at the sky. You said\nI was really cool.'
'Uh-huh. It's true. 'Cool...'
'Well, I think the Kotori I see up here, flying\nin the sky like this, is the true Kotori.'
'It seems this really is the true you.'
Kotori glanced quickly back at me to ask.
'The true me?'
'Yeah. I don't know the you from long ago, but\nthe you I see now... Well, it's just a feeling I\nhave.'
'When we fly like this it warms my heart. It\nmakes me excited.'
It's strange, but when we fly together I somehow\nknow more than before that Kotori is my\ngirlfriend.
Seeing the look on her face that could only been\nseen while flying in the sky, a look that only I\ncan see.
When I say 'excited' I mean I want to get to know\nher more, I want to see more.
'The true me...'
Kotori muttered while thinking.
'I'm sorry to bring up such an odd subject during\nflight. Please forget about it.'
'Sure, but only temporarily.'
'OK, for now that's good. This time take the\nglider into a spin yourself, and then set her\nright again.'
'Got it!'
'Alright, let's do it.'
I guided Kotori into a spin and she flew us out.
After performing so many spin maneuvers, Kotori\nbecame tired, and we decided it was time to land.
It was necessary to inspect the frame after the\nburden of practice.
We brought the glider to its final approach\ntowards the runway
'The crosswinds are strong today.. Enter the\nrunway with the nose pointing upwards.'
'Understood.'
Kotori safely and precisely landed the glider on\nthe runway.
'Kotori, Aoi, welcome back.'
'I'm baaaack! Man, I'm beat.'
Kotori, who was transferred from the cockpit seat\nto her wheelchair, looked completely exhausted.
'Well, you flew quite a bit.'
I was also quite tired.
Recovery training and the constant attention to\nsafety still made me nervous.
'Welcome back, Kotori.'
'Student council president! You came!'
'I saw you flying. You guys were living your\ndream. Now I understand your feelings for\nflight.'
'Thank you.'
Masatsugu and Kumoi waited on the ground for who\nknows how long.
'We were just at about 800 meters. Perhaps, Ms.\nKumoi might like also to try having a ride?'
'Ah, well... Before that...'
For some reason, Kumoi-san had an unpleasant\nexpression on her face. Ageha stuck her head out\nfrom behind.
'Kotori, could I talk to you for a minute?'
'What is it? Ageha?'
Kotori looked behind Ageha's shoulder and was\nsurprised to see another person standing there.
But she was dumbfounded when she recognized who\nit was.
'Why... Hibari...?'
Hibari stared at Kotori's look of disbelief.
Her face turned pale and her knees began to\nquiver.
At first I thought she was angry, but she quickly\nregained her composure.
Hibari was shaking with fear.
'Kotori...'
She called Kotori's name with a quivering voice,\nas she drew closer towards Kotori.
'What are you doing here, with this...'
'It's not what you think Hibari, this is...'
'This is...'
The explanation that Kotori wanted to give\nwouldn't come out.
'You were... flying... in that thing!'
'Please Hibari, calm down. Just listen to what I\nhave to say.'
Whack-
The sharp sound echoed.
The people nearby immediately looked up at the\nsound.
It was the sound of Kotori's sister's hand\nstriking Kotori across the face.
'Sis... ter...'
'Did you forget about that those legs of yours?'
Hibari's tears mixed with her anguished cry. Her\nknees trembled, and she was shaking so much that\nit looked like she might physically collapse.
It wasn't anger, but fear.
'I didn't forget! But this isn't a balloon! It's\nthe glider, which we made.'
'Same difference! If Mom and Dad knew... It\nwouldn't change anything.'
'Wait! Stop a minute. If Dad knew...!'
'I don't even know what Dad would do if he found\nout what you've been hiding.'
'I'm sorry, but...'
'Tell Dad.'
Hibari wouldn't hear another word, and she turned\nher back on Kotori and walked away.
'Wait, Hibari.'
Kotori tried to chase after Hibari, but Hibari\nleft too quickly.
'Hibari...'
Kotori watched Hibari's back disappear, behind a\nwall of eyes full of tears.
With the final checks done, we headed back to the\noffice.
'Where's Kotori?'
'She just went home. For the time being, we\nshould try to keep it down.'
'Yeah, we should.'
'What was that at the end?'
After that, the mood changed. Everyone silently\nfinished the last procedures of the day.
While everyone gathered at the office, I headed\nup to Kotori's dorm room.
'Kotori's legs got that way in an accident...'
'An accident that involved a hot air balloon\ncrashing on its way to its destination.'
The trip was offered through a service that\noffered sightseeing packages.
Kotori was riding in the balloon with her mother.
And it crashed.
Everyone seemed to have only minor injuries.\nEveryone except Kotori.
'So Hibari's behavior wasn't entirely out of the\nblue.'
'I'm sure that Hibari was remembering the\naccident as she stood there trembling.'
'At the time of the hot balloon accident, Hibari\nand her father were standing close enough to see\nit happen.'
Seeing Kotori getting out of the glider\nundoubtedly brought back memories.
'Kotori was hiding the fact that she was flying\nfrom Hibari.'
'I guess she didn't want to worry anyone.'
'So she has that kind of history...'
Ageha it seems was swore to secrecy.
Hibari knew that Kotori was in Soaring Club, but\nshe probably assumed that Kotori was helping to\nservice the glider or some such things.
'I don't know about those circumstances very\nwell, but any parents who saw their daughter in a\nglider like that would be worried right?'
'It was when Hibari saw Kotori being helped out\nof the cockpit that she went ghostly white.'
'You're right, it was after that.'
'...I don't know. For now, let's wait and talk\nwith Kotori later.'
'That, and we can try and contact Hibari.'
I still couldn't believe that Hibari slapped\nKotori.
That she was that angry.
'Quack?'
'I feel bad for my sister.'
'I only think of myself, even over my kind\nsister.'
'Quack...'
'But, I wanna fly.'
'I don't want to make my sister and parents\nworry, but...'
'I want to fly, at any cost.'
'So what should I do? Tell me Hat.'
'Quack.'
'Why do I want fly so much?'
'Sorry about today. You came in at a bad time.'
'No, I'm sorry for intruding. I understand your\nconcerns...'
On my way home, I called Hibari to try and\nexplain the situation.
Why Kotori decided to join the Soaring Club.
What kind of activities the Soaring Club\nparticipated in.
Without hiding anything.
'Thanks to being in the club, Kotori has become\ncheerful.'
'Yes, I agree.'
'I heard about the situation from Kotori. She's\nreally stressing out about you Hibari.'
'She's been really down because of what\nhappened.'
'She said she'd try and call you when she calmed\ndown.'
'Thank you, Aoi. I'll send her a message, too.'
'It got a little emotional today, and we didn't\nget to talk about it properly.'
'Yes, please talk to her.'
After I got off the phone, I sighed.
From where I stood, I could see Kotori's bedroom\nwindow, but the light was off.
'She's probably exhausted from crying and fell\nasleep.'
'Ah, welcome home.'
'T-thanks.'
Kotori stood at the entranceway playing with Hat.
She wore a mask that smiled, undoubtedly trying\nto be brave.
'Man, I'm starving. Do you want to grab a quick\nbite?'
'Ah, aaa...'
'Do you have a twin?'
'I wanted to get some ramen today, so I thought\nI'd go out to eat.'
'Ooh, ramen sounds good.'
She was really considerate of my feelings.
Kotori promptly went to the refrigerator and\nbegan pulling out the ingredients for dinner.
'Today we're having hashed rice. The beef has to\nthaw. Let's see... mushrooms...'
'Are you... Ok?'
'Huh? Well... I suppose I'm not exactly alright,\nbut...'
'Right.'
I know Kotori is trying to come across as\n'happy'.
But, somehow, there was a crack in her mask of\npleasantries.
'Hibari calmed down enough to try and talk. I\nwanted to apologize for keeping everything from\nher.'
'But I have to keep this as a secret from my\nparents.'
'To keep them from being worried?'
Kotori shakes her head.
'If my father knew, he would make me move back\ninto our house.'
'So I didn't say anything yet...'
'But Hibari said she called my dad today.'
'He plans on asking me to quit.'
'...With a fixed deadline. The end of summer\nbreak.'
'If that's the case, I need to talk to him\nmyself.'
'Maybe, if my father and mother both say it's\ntime to stop flying in the glider, then, I'll\nhave to call it quits.'
'Meaning I'll retire this summer, just like Amane\ndid last year.'
'Kotori...'
'And so, Aoi...'
'Ah, got it. I got your back.'
'Thanks, Aoi.'
Despite the fact that she was smiling, large\ntears had formed in her eyes and were ready to\nspill.
'W-what? What's that all about? I was just\ncrying.'
Kotori wiped away her tears with both hands.
'It's such a relief to know that I have you\nsupporting me.'
'You don't have to say it like that.'
I leaned over to Kotori and hugged her gently.
Kotori buried her face in my shoulder and sobbed.
'Hgh... Egh... This was the first time I've ever\nbeen a jerk to my sister. I was so surprised.'
'Hibari has always been kind.'
'Yeah... Something like that. Kind...'
'I'm surrounded by kind people... Lots of them...\nHiguu.'
'And yet, I'm so self-centered... Higuu, aggh...'
I pet Kotori's hair and said nothing as she cried\nherself out.
